meanings.definition: A plural noun meaning a group of ancient burial mounds.
meanings.sent1: Archaeologists discovered many tumuli in the valley.
meanings.sent2: The tumuli in the field held the remains of ancient kings.
meanings.sent3: The curious children pretended the tumuli were giant ant hills.
meanings.sent4: The tumuli stood like silent guardians of the past.
meanings.sent5: The tumuli dotted the landscape like sleeping giants.

meanings.definition: A singular noun meaning a single ancient burial mound.
meanings.sent1: A lone tumuli marked the resting place of a forgotten warrior.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists carefully excavated the tumuli to reveal its secrets.
meanings.sent3: The tumuli seemed to whisper ancient stories to the wind.
meanings.sent4: The tumuli loomed on the horizon, a solitary reminder of history.
meanings.sent5: The tumuli cast long shadows in the fading light of day.
